property.name: Rarity
property.value: Mythic Rare

property.name: Rules
property.value: {1}, Reveal Standard Procedure from your hand: Choose an instant or sorcery card with mana value 3 or less currently legal in the Standard format. Standard Procedure becomes that card until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Can it be Lightning Bolt yet?

property.name: Artist
property.value: Igor Grechanyi

property.name: Type
property.value: Artifact Creature

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Clown Robot Bard

property.name: Rules
property.value: Vigilance Assembled Ensemble's power is equal to the number of Robots you control. Whenever you cast a spell with an artifact creature in its art, create a 1/1 white Clown Robot artifact creature token.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Known for their hit single "Your Wait from This Point Is Seven Hours."

property.name: Artist
property.value: Jakub Kasper

property.name: Rules
property.value: Choose one - • Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater. • Destroy target creature with any part of its head higher than the bar. (Align the tops of both cards to check.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "You will either begin or end the ride no taller than this."

property.name: Artist
property.value: Leonardo Santanna

property.name: Rarity
property.value: Mythic Rare

property.name: Rules
property.value: Rather than choose the indicated number of modes for spells and abilities you control, you may choose one or more modes. You can't choose any mode more than once.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Memories that will technically last the rest of your life.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Bram Sels

card.name: Form of the Approach of the Second Sun

property.name: Rules
property.value: When this enchantment enters the battlefield, you gain 7 life. You become a card until you leave your library or that library is shuffled. Put yourself seventh from the top, balancing the cards on top of you on your head. When you draw yourself, you win the game. When one or more cards fall off your head, exile them and all cards on your head, then sacrifice this enchantment.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Aaron J. Riley

card.name: Get Your Head in the Game

property.name: Rules
property.value: Flash When Get Your Head in the Game enters the battlefield, exile target nonland permanent until it (this card) leaves the battlefield, then touch it (this card) to your head. When it (this card) stops touching it (your head), sacrifice it (the card, not your head).

property.name: Artist
property.value: Vincent Christiaens

property.name: Rules
property.value: Enchant nonland permanent As Gobsmacked enters the battlefield, choose a person outside the game. As long as you can see the chosen person from your seat, enchanted permanent can't attack or block, and its activated abilities can't be activated.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: You haven't seen it until you see it in 6-D.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Marco Bucci

property.name: Rules
property.value: Target blocking or blocked creature you control gets +1/+1 and gains first strike until end of turn. If it has a hat, it gains double strike until end of turn. If you and that creature each have a hat, the creature gains triple strike until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Behold the power of my hat and the ghosts of two other hats I used to own!"

property.name: Artist
property.value: Sebastian Giacobino

property.name: Type
property.value: Artifact Creature

property.name: Rules
property.value: When Impounding Lot-Bot enters the battlefield, you may say "INCARCERATE" in a robot voice. If you do, exile another target artifact or enchantment until Impounding Lot-Bot leaves the battlefield.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Not all tickets can be exchanged for prizes.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Ralph Horsley

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Human Employee

property.name: Rules
property.value: Alpha strike (This creature has first strike as long as it's blocking or being blocked by a creature that comes after it alphabetically.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "‘Carol, blast those aliens.' ‘Carol, transport those concessions.' No one cares that today is my birthday."

property.name: Artist
property.value: Tyler Walpole

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Human Knight Performer

property.name: Rules
property.value: First strike As this creature enters the battlefield, you may put a name sticker on it. This creature has protection from names that start with the same letter as a name sticker on it.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The lucky armor stopped lightning and lasers, but sadly, also love.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Sam Hogg

property.name: Rules
property.value: Choose two letters. Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control whose name begins with either of the chosen letters.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "If people are always on the edge of their seats, we can save money on chair backs." - Myra the Magnificent

property.name: Artist
property.value: Tomek Larek

property.name: Rules
property.value: As an additional cost to cast this spell, choose A through M or N through Z. Destroy each creature whose name begins with a letter in the chosen range.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Anna and Blaine said the ride was awesome. Yolanda and Zachary aren't back yet."

property.name: Artist
property.value: Mike Burns

property.name: Rules
property.value: Exile target creature you control, then return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with X +1/+1 counters on it, where X is the number of mirrors on walls you can see from your seat.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: With enough showmanship, even mundane items like playing cards or molecular teleporters can produce a mesmerizing spectacle.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Sam Hogg

property.name: Rules
property.value: Return up to two target creature cards that each have a hat and/or mana value 3 or less from your graveyard to the battlefield.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Control to Truss. Chief, the entry scan software is reading babies as hot dogs. Again." - Glaxxar, engineering assistant

property.name: Artist
property.value: Ernanda Souza

property.name: Rules
property.value: When Surprise Party enters the battlefield, yell "Surprise" and put onto the battlefield any number of printed Clown Robot tokens that aren't touching each other, that you hid on the battlefield before you cast Surprise Party, and that weren't spotted by an opponent before you cast Surprise Party. Robots you control get +1/+0 and have vigilance.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Sean Murray

property.name: Type
property.value: Artifact Creature

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Clown Robot

property.name: Rules
property.value: {T}, Tap an untapped creature you control that has a hat: Tap target creature.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "‘Technologically-Advanced, People-Pleasing Entertainment Robot,' eh? Cute. Nice hat. Be a shame if something happened to it." - "Brims" Barone, midway mobster

property.name: Artist
property.value: David Sladek

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Human Performer

property.name: Rules
property.value: Flying Trapeze Artist enters the battlefield by being flipped from a height of at least one foot (about 0.3 meters). If it lands face down or didn't turn over completely at least once during the flip, return it to its owner's hand.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Heinrich catches the trapeze only about half the time, but he looks so good falling.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Ernanda Souza

cards.card: <property name="Rules" value="You get seven . Choose an inanimate object you own from outside the game. Put a power and toughness sticker on it. You may also put a name sticker, an art sticker, and/or an ability sticker on it. Put it onto the battlefield as a creature token."/>

property.name: Rules
property.value: When Astroquarium enters the battlefield, you may put an art sticker on it. {1}, {T}: Until end of turn, target creature becomes a blue Shark with base power and toughness 4/4. If the cracks in Astroquarium's art are completely covered, that creature becomes a blue Octopus with base power and toughness 8/8 instead. Activate only as a sorcery.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Tyler Walpole

property.name: Rules
property.value: Counter target spell, then ask a person outside the game if that spell looks dangerous to them. If they say yes, draw a card, then discard a card.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "As long as there's no outside food, you're good to go."

property.name: Artist
property.value: Tyler Walpole

property.name: Rules
property.value: {3}{U}: An opponent tells you a statement about themselves and secretly notes whether it's true or false. You guess which it is. If you guessed correctly, Blufferfish gets +2/+0 and can't be blocked this turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Lying to a fish is such an unthinkable act, most planets don't even have a law against it.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Christopher Burdett

property.name: Rules
property.value: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}, where X is the number of words in the name with the most words among permanents you control.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "All you gotta do is panic with purpose. And plead your innocence with purpose. And have your mom bail you out with purpose."

property.name: Artist
property.value: Igor Grechanyi

property.name: Rules
property.value: Reveal the top three cards of your library, then choose a consonant. (Y counts.) Put each card that has the chosen letter in the first word of its name from among them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: To B, or not to B.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Setor Fiadzigbey

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Human Performer

property.name: Rules
property.value: Flash As Focused Funambulist enters the battlefield, you may put an art sticker on the empty side of the balancing pole. When you do, ask a person outside the game "Does this look balanced?" If they say yes, you may tap or untap target creature.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Setor Fiadzigbey

card.name: How Is This a Par Three?!

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever you cast a spell, you may have target player mill X cards, where X is the number of words in that spell's name.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Against the infinite backdrop of space, isn't all golf miniature?

property.name: Artist
property.value: Mike Burns

property.name: Rules
property.value: Using a mobile device, take a picture of target creature. That device enters the battlefield as a token that's a photocopy of the pictured creature. (Photocopies include Auras, Equipment, counters, and stickers in the shot. Don't touch other people's phones without permission and be careful if you do.)

property.name: Artist
property.value: Setor Fiadzigbey

property.name: Rules
property.value: When Octo Opus enters the battlefield, create a 4/4 blue Octopus Performer creature token named Contortionist with "At the beginning of your upkeep, you may fold this token in half." (It becomes 2/2, then 1/1, ½/½, and so on.) Sacrifice Octo Opus: Draw a card and an additional card for each of Contortionist's folds.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Tomek Larek

property.name: Rarity
property.value: Mythic Rare

property.name: Rules
property.value: Call someone and ask them to choose one. If they don't answer, an opponent chooses one. (Don't explain anything else. You choose targets.) • A - Gain control of target creature you don't control. • B - Choose target creature you control. Create two tokens that are each copies of it. • C - Take an extra turn after this one. • D - Draw seven cards.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Ben Wootten

property.name: Rarity
property.value: Mythic Rare

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever you cast a spell, copy it and you may choose new targets for the copy. Then balance a card from outside the game on one of your fingertips. When that card falls or touches another card, sacrifice Plate Spinning.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: For extra style points, spin them.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Raluca Marinescu

property.name: Rules
property.value: Put target creature into its owner's library just beneath the top X cards of that library, where X is the number of doors you can see from your seat.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Fblthp decided to get some sleep, nestled among the plush Ajanis until morning.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Vincent Christiaens

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Porcupine Performer

property.name: Rules
property.value: Flying Whenever you cast an alliterative spell, scry 2. (Anything with two or more capitalized words in its name that begin with the same letter is alliterative.) Other alliterative creatures you control have flying.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Dave Greco

property.name: Rules
property.value: Enchant your graveyard Enchanted graveyard is a creature on the battlefield with base power and toughness each equal to the number of cards in it. It has the text boxes of all creature cards in it. It's still a graveyard. If enchanted graveyard would leave the battlefield, instead exile Animate Graveyard.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Mike Burns

property.name: Rules
property.value: Destroy target creature. That creature's controller loses 1 life for each unique vowel in the creature's name. (The vowels are A, E, I, O, U, and Y.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Without vowels, no one can hear you scream.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Ralph Horsley

property.name: Rarity
property.value: Mythic Rare

property.name: Rules
property.value: Yell "Who wants a souvenir?" and announce the name of a nonland card in your graveyard. Each player in an Un-game who can hear you may bid life. You start the bidding at 0. The high bidder loses life equal to the high bid. They copy the card and may cast the copy without paying its mana cost. If you didn't win the bid, you gain life equal to the high bid and create that many Treasure tokens.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Chris Seaman

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Zombie Performer

property.name: Rules
property.value: When Gray Merchant of Alphabet enters the battlefield, choose a letter. For each creature you control that has the chosen letter in its name, you gain 1 life and each opponent loses 1 life.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Like any young zombie, Gary dreamed of escaping the underworld to join the circus.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Yangtian Li

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Human Hatificer Assassin

property.name: Rules
property.value: Deathtouch Whenever another creature that has a hat enters the battlefield under your control or a hat sticker is put on a creature you control, each opponent loses 1 life.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Brims" Barone's enforcers are always dressed to kill.

property.name: Artist
property.value: April Prime

property.name: Rules
property.value: Just a second (As long as this spell is on the stack, players can't move permanents.) One at a time, throw ten cards you own from outside the game onto the playing area from a distance of at least three feet (about one meter). For each of those cards, Knife and Death deals 1 damage to each creature or planeswalker you don't control that card is touching. You gain life equal to the damage dealt this way.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Caio Monteiro

property.name: Rarity
property.value: Mythic Rare

property.name: Rules
property.value: Before the game begins, you may post a picture of yourself posing like the art of any Magic card with %%GuessThatMagicCard and no other text. You may reveal a reply posted today with a guess and a card you own from outside the game with the same name as that guess. Put that card into your hand. Exile Photo Op.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Setor Fiadzigbey

property.name: Rules
property.value: Return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand. Create a Food token for each trash can you can see from your seat. (It's an artifact with "{2}, {T}, Sacrifice this artifact: You gain 3 life.")

property.name: Flavor
property.value: May contain soy. May contain a deep void, chillingly hoarse and howling without voice. May contain gluten.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Chuck Lukacs

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Rat Rogue

property.name: Rules
property.value: {T}, Sacrifice Rat in the Hat: Until end of turn, you may cast target creature card that has a hat from your graveyard.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: While the gremlin, beeble, and squirrel infestations wreaked havoc on the park, Roxi was able to spin the numerous rat colonies as a "robust recycling program."

property.name: Artist
property.value: Filipe Pagliuso

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Alien Child Guest

property.name: Rules
property.value: As long as one or more hands are touching A Real Handful, it gets +2/+2. As long as two or more hands are touching A Real Handful, it has menace. As long as three or more hands are touching A Real Handful, it has lifelink.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Tomek Larek

property.name: Rules
property.value: Add or subtract 1 from target creature's power, target player's life total, or target die roll's result. Draw a card.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "What? No, that's ridiculous! Of course the rat doesn't work for the park. I've never seen it before in my life!" - Monoxa, midway manager

property.name: Artist
property.value: Filipe Pagliuso

property.name: Rules
property.value: Creatures you control get +2/+0 and gain alpha strike until end of turn. (A creature with alpha strike has first strike as long as it's blocking or being blocked by a creature that comes after it alphabetically.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "My Abattoir Ghoul deck is unstoppable. Wait, 1996 World Champion?" - Johnny, to Spike

property.name: Artist
property.value: Tomek Larek

property.name: Rules
property.value: This spell costs {1} less to cast for each electrical socket in a wall or floor you can see from your seat. Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. Until end of turn, it gets +3/+0 and gains haste.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Space can be a lawless place - far from the prying eyes of electrical inspectors.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Jamroz Gary

property.name: Rules
property.value: Put an art sticker on a nonland permanent you own. Then ask a person outside the game to rate its new art on a scale from 1 to 5, where 5 is the best. When they rate the art, up to that many target creatures can't block this turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: There's no defending against public opinion.

property.name: Artist
property.value: April Prime

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Dog Employee

property.name: Rules
property.value: {T}: You have thirty seconds to laud a creature you control to any people outside the game. Until end of turn, that creature gains trample and haste and gets +X/+0, where X is the number of those people who applauded. Activate only as a sorcery and only once.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Dave Greco

property.name: Rules
property.value: If a hot source you control would deal damage to a permanent or player, it deals that much damage plus 1 instead. (Something is hot if it has hot things in its art, like fire or explosions.) {1}{R}, Sacrifice Don't Try This at Home: It deals damage equal to twice the number of hot cards in your graveyard to target creature or planeswalker.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Tyler Walpole

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Goblin Employee

property.name: Rules
property.value: When Goblin Blastronauts enters the battlefield, open an Attraction. Whenever you roll a 6, you may copy the spell, ability, or Attraction visit that caused you to roll that die. You may choose new targets for the copy.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The goblins really put themselves into the fireworks show, despite Myra's pleas to stop.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Dave Allsop

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Goblin Wizard Guest

property.name: Rules
property.value: Haste When Goblin Cruciverbalist enters the battlefield, create a colorless artifact token named your choice of A, E, I, O, or U. Whenever Goblin Cruciverbalist attacks, using the first letters of the names of permanents you control, spell a word you haven't spelled this game. It gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each letter in that word.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Mike Burns

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Goblin Employee

property.name: Rules
property.value: Reach Whenever you roll a die, if the result isn't stored on Goblin Girder Gang, you may store that result on it. When you do, Goblin Girder Gang deals 1 damage to any target without a hat. Goblin Girder Gang gets +1/+0 for each result stored on it.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Tyler Walpole

property.name: Type
property.value: Artifact Creature

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Clown Robot

property.name: Rules
property.value: Trample Whenever Juggletron attacks, you may put an art sticker on it. Juggletron gets +3/+0 for each item in its art that's not touching Juggletron, another item, or the card frame.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: It's all fun and games until it drops a guest. Then it's a misdemeanor.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Matt Dixon

property.name: Type
property.value: Artifact Creature

property.name: Subtype
Rules
property.value:
Affinity for Clowns (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each Clown you control.) Trample //
Pie-roclasm deals π damage to each non-Clown creature. (How to calculate π isn't important. It's a smidgen more than 3.)

property.name: Artist
Rarity
property.value: Mythic Rare

property.name: Rules
property.value: Add {W}{U}{B}{R}{G}{C}. You may open a sealed Magic booster pack. Until end of turn, you may cast spells from among the cards in that booster pack.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Oooooh!" - The crowd "Aaaaaaaaah!" - Also the crowd

property.name: Artist
property.value: Greg Bobrowski

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Elemental Performer

property.name: Rules
property.value: Reach When Rock Star enters the battlefield, you may discard a card. If you do, reveal the top five cards of your library. Ask a person outside the game to choose which of them is most like a rock band. Put that card into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Born to, and of, rock.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Dave Allsop

property.name: Type
property.value: Artifact Creature

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Clown Robot Mime

property.name: Rules
property.value: When Ticking Mime Bomb enters the battlefield, without speaking or indicating any specific creature, pantomime to a person outside the game, then they choose a creature you don't control. Ticking Mime Bomb deals damage equal to twice the number of Robots you control to the chosen creature.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Silent, but deadly.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Greg Bobrowski

property.name: Rules
property.value: Choose a triggered ability of target permanent. It triggers. You control that ability.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Whenever you copy a triggered ability, you may do a little dance.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Jamroz Gary

property.name: Rules
property.value: Well Done deals 5 damage to target creature. If that creature is rare or mythic rare, Well Done deals 3 damage to that creature's controller.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "What's the big deal? I've been on fire eighty-one times. Twice just while sleeping." - Devil K. Nevil, daredevil extraordinaire

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Elf Employee

property.name: Rules
property.value: When Alpha Guard enters the battlefield, choose a letter. {T}: Untap another target permanent whose name starts with the chosen letter.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Whimsy overflow in sector G! The gremlins are rampaging and the beebles are on fire!"

property.name: Artist
property.value: Caroline Gariba

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Human Employee

property.name: Rules
property.value: Each +1/+1 counter on a creature you control is also a Food token. (It's an artifact with "{2}, {T}, Sacrifice this artifact: You gain 3 life.") {3}{G}, {T}: Roll two six-sided dice. For each odd result, put a +1/+1 counter on a creature of your choice. Activate only as a sorcery.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Her most popular flavors are vanilla, maple pecan crunch, and Glurgian galactopod.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Raluca Marinescu

property.name: Rules
property.value: Choose one or both - • Destroy target creature with flying. • Destroy target Attraction. (It's put into its owner's junkyard.) You may apologize. If you do, you gain 3 life.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "So sorry, but, per our waiver, we're not responsible for ‘things happening.'"

property.name: Artist
property.value: Greg Bobrowski

property.name: Rarity
property.value: Mythic Rare

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever Killer Cosplay becomes attached to a creature, choose a creature card name with an identical mana cost. That creature becomes a copy of the card with the chosen name until Killer Cosplay becomes unattached from it. Equip {3}

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Ach! Hans, run! Get the camera. He's adorable!" - Steffi Bobsdotter, next words

property.name: Artist
property.value: Leonardo Santanna

property.name: Rules
property.value: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. Create a 1/1 green Squirrel creature token for each fire extinguisher you can see from your seat.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: In hindsight, Chandra's Incendiary Experience should never have been built next to Auntie Grub's House of Pitch.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Ralph Horsley

property.name: Rules
property.value: As an additional cost to cast this spell, gobble X. (Each time you gobble, take a bite of food or sacrifice a Food token.) X target creatures you control each get +2/+2 and gain trample until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The pie was outstanding. The cobbler tasted like shoes.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Simon Dominic

property.name: Rules
property.value: Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and can't be blocked except by creatures with flavor text.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "If you've got words, we're going to have words."

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Elf Performer

property.name: Rules
property.value: {T}: Add {T}{T}. Activate only once each turn. (While activating an ability, use {T} rather than tapping the permanent to pay for {T}.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Elven tap is the official language of three very obnoxious planets.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Anna Christenson

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Alien Insect

property.name: Rules
property.value: Flying, deathtouch Whenever Spelling Bee deals combat damage to a player, that player looks at the top card of your library and chooses a word on that card. You spell that word. If you spell it correctly, draw a card. Otherwise, scry 1.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Just be thankful it wasn't grammar scorpions.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Caroline Gariba

property.name: Rules
property.value: Whenever you create a token or put a counter or a sticker on another permanent, put a knickknack counter on Tchotchke Elemental. Use a unique item that completely fits on Tchotchke Elemental for each knickknack counter. Tchotchke Elemental gets +1/+1 for each knickknack counter on it.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Sean Murray

property.name: Rarity
property.value: Mythic Rare

property.name: Rules
property.value: Players play a subgame starting at 5 life and with up to three permanent cards with different names from their main-game library on the battlefield. As the subgame ends, the winner chooses one of the cards they put onto the battlefield as the subgame began and puts it onto the battlefield rather than shuffling it into their library.

property.name: Rules
property.value: Autograph Book enters the battlefield with a page counter on it for each person who has signed it. {3}, {T}, Remove a page counter from Autograph Book: Draw a card.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "It was a pleasure to meet me." - Captain Rex Nebula

property.name: Artist
property.value: Ben Maier

property.name: Rules
Artist
property.value: Chuck Lukacs

property.name: Type
property.value: Artifact Enchantment

property.name: Rarity
property.value: Mythic Rare

property.name: Rules
property.value: As this Saga enters and after your draw step, add a lore counter. Sacrifice after III.) As an additional cost to cast this spell, exile five instant and/or sorcery cards you own with the same artist and different names from outside the game. I, II, III - Choose one of the exiled cards at random. You may cast it without paying its mana cost.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Alix Branwyn

property.name: Rules
property.value: {1}, Sacrifice Park Map: Search your library for a land card that doesn't have the same art as a permanent you control, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: It's always up-to-date, so visitors know what rides are open, how long the lines are, and which areas are closed due to gremlins.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Kirsten Zirngibl

property.name: Rules
Artist
property.value: Michael Phillippi

property.name: Rules
property.value: {T}: Add one mana of any color that appears on your top. (A top is an outerwear garment worn on the upper body.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The glow of the big top can be seen for light years, but its excitement can be felt in the hearts of everyone who's ever been there.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Kirsten Zirngibl

property.name: Rules
property.value: Rangeling (This card is every land type, including Plains, Island, Swamp, Mountain, Forest,Desert, Gate, Lair, Locus, and all those Urza's ones.) Nearby Planet enters the battlefield tapped. When Nearby Planet enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you pay {1}.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Here's a nice place we haven't hit yet." - Captain Rex Nebula

property.name: Artist
property.value: Bruce Brenneise

property.name: Subtype
property.value: Urza’s

property.name: Rules
property.value: {T}: Add {C}. {T}: Add {+oo}. Activate only once and only if you control an Urza's Mine, an Urza's Power-Plant, and an Urza's Tower. {7}, {T}: Head to AskUrza.com and click Urza's Fun House.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Dmitry Burmak

property.name: Rules
property.value: Visit - Each player draws a card from the library of the player to their right. You create three Treasure tokens. Lights - 3, 6

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Originally, the rotors were used exclusively as particle accelerators for engine fuel, and they probably still should be.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Greg Staples

property.name: Rules
property.value: Visit - Each player draws a card from the library of the player to their right. You create three Treasure tokens. Lights - 4, 6

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The back of each ticket features a map to the lost and found.

property.name: Artist
property.value: Greg Staples

cards.card: <property name="Rules" value="Visit - Drop three cards you own from outside the game one at a time onto the playing area from a height of at least one foot (about 0.3 meters). Lights - 2, 3, 4, 6"/>

property.name: Rules
property.value: Visit - Exile cards from the top of your library until you exile a nonland card, then choose a legendary creature card name with the same mana value as that card. Create a token that's a copy of the card with the chosen name. That token gains haste. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step. Lights - 3, 6

property.name: Rules
property.value: Visit - Look at the bottom card of your library, then give a person outside the game a one-word clue not on that card. They guess a word. If their guess appears in that card's name, claim the prize Prize - Reveal the card, put it into your hand, then sacrifice Guess Your Fate and open an Attraction. Lights - 2, 3, 4, 6

property.name: Rules
property.value: Visit - Choose up to four creatures you control. Those creatures jump in a log until end of turn. (Creatures in a log together can't be blocked unless they're all blocked. If a spell or ability you control targets one of them, it targets all of them.) Lights - 3, 6

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Keep your hands and feet inside me at all times and enjoy the glubbbbrbb! Glbbglubb! Glb!"

property.name: Artist
property.value: Marco Bucci

property.name: Rules
property.value: Visit - Choose up to four creatures you control. Those creatures jump in a log until end of turn. (Creatures in a log together can't be blocked unless they're all blocked. If a spell or ability you control targets one of them, it targets all of them.) Lights - 5, 6

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Thanks for riding, and be sure not to leaf anything behind! Just some tree humor for you."

property.name: Artist
property.value: Marco Bucci

property.name: Rules
property.value: When Memory Test enters the battlefield, target opponent exiles cards from the bottom of their library until they exile five nonland cards, then turns those nonland cards face down. Visit - Name the exiled face-down cards, then look at them. If you named them correctly, turn them face up, then claim the prize Prize - Create three 1/1 red Balloon creature tokens with flying, then sacrifice Memory Test and open an Attraction. Lights - 4, 6

property.name: Artist
property.value: Setor Fiadzigbey

property.name: Rules
property.value: When Memory Test enters the battlefield, target opponent exiles cards from the bottom of their library until they exile five nonland cards, then turns those cards face down. Visit - Name the exiled nonland cards, then look at the exiled cards. If you named them correctly, claim the prize Prize - Create three 1/1 red Balloon creature tokens with flying, then sacrifice Memory Test and open an Attraction. Lights - 5, 6

property.name: Artist
property.value: Setor Fiadzigbey

property.name: Rules
property.value: Visit - Reveal cards from the top of your library until you decide to stop. If the total mana value of the cards revealed this way is 7 or less, create a 2/2 pink Teddy Bear creature token. If the total is exactly 7, claim the prize Shuffle the revealed cards into your library. Prize - Put five +1/+1 counters on a Teddy Bear you control. It gains haste. Sacrifice Push Your Luck and open an Attraction. Lights - 2, 3, 6

property.name: Artist
property.value: Sebastian Giacobino

property.name: Rules

property.name: Rules
property.value: Visit - An opponent chooses "the fastest," "the scariest," or "the weakest." You choose a creature, then ask a person outside the game to choose the creature that best fits the chosen criteria. If they chose the same creature you chose, claim the prize Prize - Create two 1/1 red Balloon creature tokens with flying, then sacrifice The Superlatorium and open an Attraction. Lights - 2, 3, 6

property.name: Artist
property.value: Simon Dominic

property.name: Rules
property.value: As Water Gun Balloon Game enters the battlefield, each player puts a pop counter on "0." Whenever a player casts a spell, move that player's pop counter up one. Whenever a player's pop counter hits "5," that player creates a 5/5 pink Giant Teddy Bear creature token and resets all pop counters to "0."

property.name: Artist
property.value: Ralph Horsley
